algorithms.name:
Orbital Branching via Nauty Symmetry Detection

NOTE: This code is currently commented out/disabled.

Implements orbital branching which exploits problem symmetry to
reduce the search space. Uses nauty library to detect symmetries
and organize variables into orbits.

**Orbital branching concept:**
If variables {x1, x2, x3} are symmetric (permutable without
changing the problem), then branching on any one of them is
equivalent. The orbit {x1, x2, x3} can be treated as a single
branching decision, pruning symmetric subtrees.

**Node class:**
Stores variable metadata for symmetry detection:
- index: variable index
- coeff, lb, ub: bounds and coefficients
- color: vertex coloring for nauty

**Integration with nauty:**
- Compute_Symmetry(): Calls nauty to find automorphisms
- Print_Orbits(): Display detected orbits
- ChangeBounds(): Update bounds respecting symmetry
